It was commissioned by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal and completed shortly after her death in 1631. The Taj Mahal is renowned for its perfect symmetry, intricate inlays of precious and semi-precious stones, and the extensive use of calligraphy from the Quran.

Image 2 shows the Agra Fort, also located in Agra, India. It was initially constructed by Emperor Akbar in 1565 and later expanded by his grandson, Shah Jahan, the same emperor who commissioned the Taj Mahal. The Agra Fort is a significant example of Mughal architecture and is known for its massive sandstone walls, bastions, and palaces.

Image 3 features the Kremlin in Moscow, Russia. The Kremlin is a historic fortified complex at the heart of Moscow, Russia, and serves as the official residence of the President of Russia. It was founded in 1156 by Prince Andrei Bogolyubsky and originally served as a fortress. Over the centuries, it has been the site of numerous significant events in Russian history.
